heading: 3. The following particulars shall be specified by an employer or a
text_raw:
3. The following particulars shall be specified by an employer or a 

responsible person in a notification under section 12 of the Act of 1977: 

(a) 

(i) 

the name and address of the employer and, where 
applicable, of the responsible person; 

(ii) 

contact details of the employer or responsible person; 

(iii) whether the employer is a sole trader, a partnership or a 

body corporate; 

(iv) where the employer is a body corporate, its registration 
number on the register (within the meaning of section 
887(2) of the Companies Act 2014) kept by the Registrar of 
Companies; 

the address or addresses of the establishment where the collective 
redundancies are proposed; 

the total number of persons normally employed, within the 
meaning of section 8 of the Act of 1977, at that establishment; 

the number and descriptions or categories of employees whom it 
is proposed to make redundant; 

the period during which the collective redundancies are proposed 
to be effected, stating the dates on which the first and the final 
dismissals are expected to take effect; 

the reasons for the proposed collective redundancies; 

the names and contact details of the employee representatives; 

the employee

heading: 4. The Protection of Employment Act 1977 (Notification of Proposed
text_raw:
4. The Protection of Employment Act 1977 (Notification of Proposed 
Collective Redundancies) Regulations 1977 (S.I. No. 140 of 1977) are revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 July, 2024. 

PETER BURKE, 

Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [324] 

EXPLANTORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
Interpretation) 

These Regulations prescribe the particulars to be specified by an employer or 
responsible person in a notification under Section 12 of the Protection of 
Employment Act 1977.
